means: 陈列，展览
呈现
证明
[法]提交证据
公开展览某物
展出
展览，陈列
展览品
公开展示
[法]证据

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都可表示"展览"或"展览会"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: exhibition, exhibit, show, exposition, fair, display
means: exhibition ： 一般指较正规的展览会。
exhibit ： 多指个人或团体陈列的展览品，规模可大可小。
show ： 指艺术品、农产品、工业品或商品等的任何形式的公开展览。
exposition ： 多指大型博览会或国际博览会。
fair ： 侧重指为促销商品而举办的展览会或商品交易会。
display ： 指展销会，商店橱窗或柜台上的陈列品。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"显示，显露，展现"之意。
means: show ： 最普通用词，泛指任何有意或无意地把东西给别人看的行为。
exhibit ： 指公开或正式地展示，以便引人注目或让人检查。
display ： 多指将某物陈列在显眼之处以便让发现其优点，侧重有意识地显示。
manifest ： 书面正式用词，指明确地表明。
demonstrate ： 指明显地表露感情。也指用实例、实验推理等手段表演证明，或论证某一问题。

sentence.Network_en: Two cats or more in one house will also exhibit territorial behaviour.
sentence.Network_cn: 一家若有两只或更多的猫，也会表现出争夺地盘的行为。

sentence.Network_en: He seems to want to exhibit his shame.
sentence.Network_cn: 他似乎想要让大家知道自己感到羞愧。

sentence.Network_en: In this job you need to exhibit the wisdom of Solomon.
sentence.Network_cn: 做这份工作需要表现出所罗门王一样的才智。

MODELCLUB ... 历史故事 History 展览会 Exhibition 新人报到 Checkin.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'submit for consideration', also specifically'present a document as evidence in court'): from Latin exhibit- 'held out', from the verb exhibere, from ex- 'out' + habere 'hold'

encyclopedia.content: 释义 词目：展览 拼音：zhǎn lǎn 基本解释 展览（exhibition），著作权法术语，指公开陈列美术作品、摄影作品的原件或者复制件。展览会既是信息，通讯和娱乐的综合，也是唯一的在面对面沟通中充分挖掘五官感觉的营销媒介。二十世纪尽管出现高速的电子通讯方式，展览会，作为临时的市场，仍然是最专业、有效的销售工具。

entry.def: If someone or something shows a particular quality, feeling, or type of behaviour, you can say that they exhibit it.

example.ex: He has exhibited symptoms of anxiety and overwhelming worry...
example.tran: 他表现出焦躁不安和过度忧虑的症状。

example.ex: Two cats or more in one house will also exhibit territorial behaviour...
example.tran: 一所房子里有两只以上的猫时也会出现划分地盘的行为。

entry.def: When a painting, sculpture, or object of interest is exhibited, it is put in a public place such as a museum or art gallery so that people can come to look at it. You can also say that animals are exhibited in a zoo.

example.ex: His work was exhibited in the best galleries in America, Europe and Asia.
example.tran: 他的作品在美洲、欧洲和亚洲最好的美术馆展出。

example.ex: ...a massive elephant exhibited by London Zoo in the late 19th Century.
example.tran: 19世纪末伦敦动物园展出的一头巨型大象

entry.def: When artists exhibit, they show their work in public.

example.ex: By 1936 she was exhibiting at the Royal Academy.
example.tran: 到1936年她已在皇家艺术学院展出作品。

entry.def: An exhibit is a painting, sculpture, or object of interest that is displayed to the public in a museum or art gallery.

example.ex: Shona showed me round the exhibits.

entry.def: An exhibit is a public display of paintings, sculpture, or objects of interest, for example in a museum or art gallery.

example.ex: ...an exhibit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
example.tran: 大都会艺术博物馆的展览

entry.def: An exhibit is an object that a lawyer shows in court as evidence in a legal case.
If you say that someone exhibits something, you mean that they are showing it openly or publicly in order to be admired, noticed, or believed.

example.ex: Other women seemed content and even exhibited their bellies with pride...
example.tran: 其他女人似乎很满足，甚至还骄傲地炫耀她们的肚腩。

example.ex: He seems to want to exhibit his shame.
example.tran: 他似乎想要让大家知道自己感到羞愧。

means.word_mean: 1. an object or statement produced before a court of law and referred to while giving evidence

sentences.sentence: "the museum had many exhibits of oriental art"

means.word_mean: 1. show an attribute, property, knowledge, or skill;
2. to show, make visible or apparent;

sentences.sentence: "The Metropolitan Museum is exhibiting Goya's works this month"
"Why don't you show your nice legs and wear shorter skirts?"
"National leaders will have to display the highest skills of statesmanship"

means.word_mean: 3. show or demonstrate something to an interested audience;

sentences.sentence: "We will demo the new software in Washington"
"She parades her new husband around town"

auth_sentence.content: They already exhibit what may be a complex language.
auth_sentence.res_content: They already exhibit what may be a complex language.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They already exhibit what may be a complex language.

auth_sentence.content: The most perfect dresser that even France could exhibit.
auth_sentence.res_content: The most perfect dresser that even France could exhibit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The most perfect dresser that even France could exhibit.

auth_sentence.content: Conscientiousness indicates how well we plan and exhibit self-control.
auth_sentence.res_content: Conscientiousness indicates how well we plan and exhibit self-control.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Conscientiousness indicates how well we plan and exhibit self-control.

stems_affixes.word_buile: prohibit[v.禁止,不准;阻止]+ive……的→adj.抑制的,价格昂贵的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 放荡不羁的, 不受抑制的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un不+inhibit[v.抑制,约束]+ed……的→adj.放荡不羁的, 不受抑制的
exhibit[v.展出,陈列 n.展览品,陈列品]+ion表名词→n.展览会;陈列,展览
exhibition[n.展览会;陈列,展览]+ist人→n.喜欢出风头的人

stems_affixes.value_cn: 抑制;阻止,禁止;[心]感情阻力
stems_affixes.word_buile: inhibit[v.抑制,约束]+ion表名词→n.抑制;阻止,禁止;[心]感情阻力
prohibit[v.禁止,不准;阻止]+ion表名词→n.禁止;禁令,禁律
pro前面+hibit拿住→在前面拿住→不让前进→禁止

Sentence.sentence: Since it's raining so hard, let's go and see the new exhibits.
What do you think Picasso's painting exhibited in the city museum?
They offer to let me exhibit some of my paintings here.

sentences.en: Next week those goods will exhibit in that shop.
sentences.cn: 下个星期, 这些货物将在那家商店展出。

sentences.en: She exhibited her paintings at our school.
sentences.cn: 她在我们学校展览绘画。

sentences.en: The first exhibit was a knife which the prosecution claimed was the murder weapon.
sentences.cn: 当庭出示的第一件证物是一把刀, 据原告称是谋杀凶器。

jushi.english: This young photographer exhibited in the Workers's Club.
jushi.chinese: 这位年轻摄影师在工人俱乐部展出作品。

jushi.english: Next week those goods will exhibit in that shop.
jushi.chinese: 下个星期,这些货物将在那家商店展出。

jushi.english: The young painter has not yet exhibited his work.
jushi.chinese: 这位年轻的作家还没有展览过他的作品。
